Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: alexander1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, in march, the hotel was lovely, very clean, and the staff were very nice, and very helpful, a special word of thanks to Mark, on the front desk, who was of much help to us, nothing was to much trouble, and the young lady who did the breakfast was lovely.This hotel was in an area where its very quiet, and a lot of bars/cafes close for the weekend, there is a metro station, 5 mins walk away, i would recomend this hotel for people who would like a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique in 8eme nearby everything”
Reviews.Author: jlasdf
Reviews.Content: Like many smaller hotels in the neighborhood, I think it really depends which room you get, as they are certainly not uniform. I was lucky to have the ground floor unit - which was a fairly spacious room. One must walk through the unheated courtyard to get to it, but the room itself was quite spacious and had french doors that opened to the patio. I'm sure it would be a really nice room for the summer / autumn months.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Arioso”
Reviews.Author: Laurent F
Reviews.Content: A great Boutique Hotel in close proximity to the Champs Elysées.Charming little hotel with great location. Fantastic staff, very helpful and smiling. Our room was spotless, very well decorated with a unique theme, the bathroom was beautifully done and very luxurious with a spa bath big enough for two.We enjoyed our stay and don't regret our choice. We won't hesitate to go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “This is Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Tatia065
Reviews.Content: Everything is clean, breakfast is good, staff were efficient, friendly & helpful. Rooms are very small so would recommend the superior bedrooms. a bit expensive, but this is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Charming”
Reviews.Author: PMSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister as a tag along to her as she had a work conference to Paris. I have previousy stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile but chose to stay here because of reviews on trip advisor, and as Royal Magda was booked out. The room was very clean, and a good size by Paris standards. It had all the necessities. The bathroom was also nicer compared to the Royal Magda ( sorry but I have only stayed in these two hotels so far, when I return to Paris I will try another different hotel just to compare). We had a lovely little window which looked over the courtyard. It was quiet and good for sleeping. The hotel was easy to get to/from Metro, and also around the corner is Monoprix Supermarket for drinks etc...also nearby is Galleries Lafayette and Printemps department stores. Galleries have a great Gourmet Foodhall and wines to purchase to drink. Walking distance to the Louvre and Champs Elysee about 15-20 minutes. But if you are someone who doesn't like walking then you may choose elsewhere. But Paris is a beautiful city to walk around and discovering new shops and cafes is best done by walking all over and the backstreets. There is a lack of restaurants around the hotel but we were happy to walk and eat elsewhere and return to the hotel for a quiet and restful sleep. The room across from us had their own balcony and patio to have drinks. Very quaint and pretty place. Staff were always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAVEDurhamUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed, 10 mins from Champs Elysee and Opera. It is delightfully appointed and immaculately kept, lots of classy little touches. The room and bathroom were everything you could want. Staff were very helpful and recommended two lovely restaurants to us. The breakfast was more than adequate although I must admit I would be happy with endless supply of delicious French bread and coffee. Would definitely stop here again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Nelis82
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room for the weekend and that's what we got. The room was as to be expected small but clean, comfortable and with a balcony - an excellent place to have breakfast. The service was excellent and the location quite good as well, with the opera and la fayette at a 10 - 15 minute walk, through a nice part of Paris. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: 2Travel2930
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arioso far exceeded my expectations. The room was charming, impeccably maintained, and a welcome haven after a long day of touring Paris. The bath was modern and included a large soaking tub, pedestal sink, and marble finishes. The staff was personable and always eager to meet the guests needs. The public rooms were lovely, and where breakfast, which included a variety of fresh pastries and fruit, was served each morning. The location is ideal, close to everything but away from the tourist congestion and traffic. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience Paris as a Parisian. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Adrian48
Reviews.Content: This small centrally located boutique hotel proved to be a real find. The rooms are small but tastefully decorated, well equipped and immaculately clean. My stay was business related so free wifi was appreciated and in comparison to many other hotels in the area this hotel was value for money! I would definitely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: jadestone8888
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel. It is a small hotel not too far from Champs Alysees Ave (walking distance). You also can walk to Louvre (that was what we did, maybe 20 min). It is 2-3 blocks from a Metro station. We stayed in a Quad room, actually it was duplex (separate rooms behind a common door), perfect for a family with 2 teenagers. Hotel room are not large but very clean and very well decorated. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. Breakfast is fine too. This was our first trip to Europe and the first hotel, not knowing what to expect for breakfast, but the selection is much limited than American continental breakfast at the similarly rated hotels. The taxi they helped to arrange for us to Orly ariport caused 58 euros, much more than what we paid for the taxi from CDG to the hotel (45 euros, we give 50), although the distance is shorter. This was not their problem, but you better check with them the price before taking that taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Best accommodation experience in Europe”
Reviews.Author: DTTravels67
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arioso is just fantastic, it has so much charm and the rooms have been wonderfully kept. The staff are very friendly and so helpful. Location is ideal and great for just wondering around. A hotel with the charm of a great B&B. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at this very friendly hotel. Apart from the great location (just 2 min walk from the Metro station) and a short walk away from Champs Elysees - the warmth, courtsey and helpfulness of the Staff was endearing. The rooms were small (maybe as expected in Paris) but very clean, breakfast was adequate but limited and the hotel does not have facilities like late hour dining, fitness centre or swimming pool. However, over-all the experience was very good and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Soixante17
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about the Hotel Arioso. The staff were all so friendly and helpful with everything and as a plus, they all speak english, which was helpful since my french is rusty. Hotel Arioso is right in the center of the city and close to everything! The location is perfect!! The rooms are so cute and clean and I absolutely fell in love with the bathrooms! Breakfast was delicious! I highly recommend this hotel if you're traveling to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Anamarija7
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris three times and every time I stayed at the Arioso hotel. It is a real 4 stars hotel with tidy rooms, nice breakfast and helpful staff. Located in the center of the city, it is easy to acces all famous sights. Just a perfect stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very nice cozy well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maha54
Reviews.Content: our stay in this hotel was very pleasant. the staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and well located, the room + the bathroom were very clean, cozy and classical style. I will definitely stay there in my next trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “super chouette”
Reviews.Author: bibouCabedelloBresil
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had been staying at Hotel Arioso for six nights two month ago..All staffs were very friendly and sincerity.Their recommended restaurants and a beauty treatment salon were all nice. Thank you for this wonderfull stay !!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice small hotel , staff very friendly, but rooms are very small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: polinka25
Reviews.Content: Small but very nice hotel with wonderfull staff. room are very small , but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very friendly staff, beautiful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Valy_RO
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Arioso hotel for 3 days in March. This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in France. So, I will like to give you more details: 1) ROOMS - although the rooms are small (this is the same in all French hotels) they are trully beautiful. STYLE is the word that describes the rooms! They are brand new, very confortable, very good bed, pillows and the bathroom is very very nice. The room has a plasma TV. Minibar prices are smaller than in other hotels I have stayed in France. 2) HOTEL - very nice hotel, very new, with a nice lobby with a wonderful design that gets you into the "Paris" mood. 3) STAFF - extremly friendly staff. They offered immediately to help us with the sorroundings, the best places to visit in Paris and they are at your disposal at any time. 4) LOCATION - PERFECT! Situated 50 m away from Haussman Boulevard close to the biggest shopping area in Paris, 10 minutes walk to the Arc of Trioumph, 5 minutes walk to Champs Elyssee, 2 minutes walk to 2 metro stations. It is the perfect location if you want to explore Paris or to go shopping. 5) BREAKFAST - open buffet, very rich, with nice choice of pastry and cheese and the juice is very fresh and tasteful. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: sslusser1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Arioso for 3 nights. Overall, a solid hotel. The room was nice though it was small. From researching other hotels for this visit this seems to be fairly standard for Paris, but I wont lie, I was a little disappointed at the size of the room when we first opened the door especially for the price (approximately $220/usd per night). However, this is a minor complaint, the rooms were clean, nicely decorated with a comfortable bed and a nice bathroom. The room had free in-room wifi access though it was a bit annoying to have to always re-sign in to the wi-fi service, a small complaint, sure, but what can I say I have high tech expectations. Our favorite part of the hotel was the staff. They helped me with all of our questions whether it was for suggestions food dining, helping us map out our daily itinerary or simply answering our various questions about life in Paris. The location was visually stunning and as good as any for touristy stuff. The hotel is located between two subway stations accessible in less than 5 minutes by foot allowing you to get around the city fairly easily. It took us a little more than 10 minutes to walk to the Champs de elysee and to the Madeline districts. The only caution I would offer is that the immediate neighborhood shuts down fairly early and completely shuts down on Sunday. Not that big of a deal if you are jumping around the city but I could see where it might be a little frustrating if you just want to walk to get a quick bite to eat. All in all, the hotel satisfied all our needs as a home base for exploring the city

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay,good location !!”
Reviews.Author: Fionaadams64
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend (3 nights)with a couple of friends,the location was very good you could walk everywhere and also there is a metro station just a minute from the hotel. Room is small but clean and the bathroom is great.Staff was very helpful would defiantly stay there again.. love that charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babapou
Reviews.Content: I have been at hotel Arioso and i found it marvellous ,the peole very gentle and helpful ,the location is excellent i will go back and i will tell to all my friends to come in this pearl of hotel. Lot of restaurant next to the Hotel and breakfast was good and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jkkandkk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arioso was a perfect choice for us. We are not frequent European travelers, so our basis for comparison is only American hotels. We interacted with at least three of the hotel staff and all were very friendly, accomodating and helpful. Our room was small, but I beleive it be comparable size for similar hotels and was perfect for us and just what we were looking for. Even in the cold winter month of December I enjoyed the balcony. Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. A 2-3 block walk to metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Added to our beautiful experience of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Nadia_and_Andrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away off a main road (Bvld Haussman) so despite being so central and close to everything - it was very quiet and cozy! It took us 20mins to walk to the Champs Elysees passing amazing patisseries, cafes and restaurants along the way. The staff were very friendly and only to happy to help. The rooms were fairly small - but big enough for two people. The bathrooms were a great size considering the size of the rooms. The hotel and rooms were very clean and definitely had an authentic Parisian feel! Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, welcoming, nice area”
Reviews.Author: spartacusuk
Reviews.Content: Almost boutique hotel, pricey but very high standards, and the balcony rooms are particularly nice. Staff brilliant and bilingual. Breakfast is very pricey, but there is an award willing boulangerie at the top of the street, and plenty of places to buy drinks/food. Decor is great, beds are great, even the water coming into the bath is the best water coming into the bath ever...all power and no noise! While in the area it's worth seeing the wonderful Musee Jacquomart (I'm sure that's not the right spelling), 2 minutes walk, and the big park just to the north (which itself has a great oriental museum adjacent).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and calm place to discover Paris”
Reviews.Author: FloBerndt
Reviews.Content: The Arioso is totally great Hotel to spend a few nights in the center of Paris. It is calm, in walking distance (more or less) of both the great shopping places at blv. Hausmann and the Champs Elysee. Its interior is rather romantic, old-fashioned but the rooms have been refurbished recently I think - and the bathrooms are small, but pretty (which is not alway the case in Paris). Try to ask for a room on the upper floors - the ground floor is a bit awkward.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Arioso-great value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lovesublime
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Arioso for 2 nights, and loved it. We booked a superior room which is WELL WORTH the extra few euro, considering the size of hotel rooms in Paris. It was still on the small side (you had to squeeze along the wall and far corner of the bed to get to the opposite side) but thats my only issue with the room. It was cozy, had plenty of windows, a very spacious bathroom, comfortable bed, ample storage space, bathrobes, and lots of l'Occitane toiletries. The breakfast had a good enough variety. Breads, criossants and other pastries, jams and nutella, boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, FRESHLY SQUEEZED orange juice and grapefruit juice, coffee and tea, fresh and dried fruit, sliced meats and cheese. If you want a hotel with a full hot breakfast or restaurant, dont stay here. The hotel is located on a quiet street within walking distance to the Champs Elysees and many other sights as well as a metro stop (Miromesnil) The woman who worked at the desk during the day (not sure if she was the owner) was very helpful with anything we needed. I will definitely stay here any time I return to Paris. They also have free internet in the reception lounge

Reviews.Title: “Charming subtle elegance in quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: A small charming hotel along an unremarkable street in the center of the 8th arrondissement, between the church of St. Augustin, the Parc Monceau and the Champs-Elysees. The Arioso is not truly next to anything of great import, however not far from many things. And, as always, the nearby metro will whisk you to destinations across Paris. The hotel is elegant and peaceful, yet small and unassuming. Run by one person at the small front desk, with a living room atmosphere, the hotel also has a charming back patio in a small courtyard that has been decorated in a most romantic fashion. A drink or bite to eat would be a great choice! My room was equally interesting, with a bed set into the wall, with wooden shelves built in around each side of the pillows and smart reading lamps for each side of the bed. The room was typically small, but not overly so, and a nice small flat-screen tv had good cable programming. The one-staff team (I met two of them during my stay) were always friendly, casual and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Swaveck
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it was walking distance to city centre, and also because it is great area. Rooms are very small but clean and serviced every day. Breakfast was just fair, and none other meals you can have it in hotel, but spirits they have are just top of the range. Four stars is to much for this hotel, but maybe french system giving them with one on the top. Anyway it is a great hotel and i will recomend it to stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: notoneformoaning
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from a 2 night stay whilst visiting Paris for an Interior design exhibition and when choosing somewhere to stay I was looking for a small clean Hotel without fuss that we could use as a base. Upon arrival I was delighted to see that the reception and ground floor were as beautifully decorated as I had heard and staff were very friendly. I was just as delighted when shown our room, yes it was small but decor was lovely and everywhere so clean. Breakfast was a little cosy as all guests seemed to descend on the little room at once, but food and service first class. During the last few years I have stayed at some of the largest most expensive Hotels in Paris and this little dolls house size hotel so impressed me that I was prompted to write this review. It is also very close to the metro and within walking distance of the Champs Elysee, Madeleine and the Haussmann shops.

Reviews.Title: “A chilling experience!”
Reviews.Author: champagnesliv
Reviews.Content: Although a year has passed since my stay at Hotel Arioso, I am still annoyed about my experience at this establishment. The location of the hotel was not great, with few eateries in the vicinity, but I was aware of that from reviews I had read prior to booking. The tariff was quite high but as I was travelling alone, I wanted a hotel where I would feel relaxed and happy to spend time. Initially I was delighted with my choice. My room was small but beautiful. The bathroom was lovely and the cleanliness of the accommodation excellent. The decor of the hotel overall was very pleasing and I found the one member of staff on duty to be courteous and pleasant. I slept badly however, because I was cold and the following day the weather was so bad that I returned to the hotel mid afternoon to warm up and rest prior to looking for somewhere to eat that evening. I was so cold in my room that I had to get into bed with my clothes on and all the bedding I could lay my hands on simply to watch T.V. By evening I felt quite ill with cold and unable to venture out into the rain for supper, so went downstairs to speak to the receptionist ( I speak French so at no point was there any failure in communication). I was told that there was a problem with the central heating system and it would be rectified as soon as possible. No food was available but he could make me a pot of tea. ( 5 euros was added to my bill). The heating was not re-instated until my third and last night there. When I paid my bill that evening to a different solitary member of staff, I asked if a small reduction might be made to compensate for the extreme discomfort I had experienced due to the breakdown of the heating system. To my great irritation I was told that the malfunction had only affected the part of the hotel that I had been accommodated in and that his colleague could have moved me to another room! No reduction was made however. A short time after my visit I decided to write to the hotel and explain my dissatisfaction and request a small recompense. A letter and two emails later I finally received a short, unapologetic refusal. The cost of the three nights at Arioso was equal to two weeks wages to me, I felt very badly done by indeed. A shame as the hotel had such potential.

Reviews.Title: “cute little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Boomlee
Reviews.Content: We spent the week of 14th July in this centrally located hotel and we couldn't have asked for more. All the actions of "la journee nationale" was happening so close to our hotel. We just loved the hotel and its service. Room was small but it had everything that a big room would provide. We spent a month in different locations in Europe and hotel Arioso has been one of our preferred hotels. Karuna & Sandip Ganguli

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended - for the right price”
Reviews.Author: Dreblowski
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay at Arioso. The rooms were newly refurbished, modern and very clean. Granted the rooms were fairly small, as one of the other reviews said, but not by Parisien standards. The staff were excellent and it was a great location. We managed to get a deal on their site by booking consecutive nights, though believe the 'usual' prices quoted are a bit of a rip off. We would definitely stay there again; but not for full price.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars??? I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: Kbel3
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying in Paris with my husband at a nice hotel. I have only ever stayed with relatives in their apartments or in pokey 2 star hotels so I had made this selection as carefully as I could, using a 'luxury, design hotels' specialist website...hmmmm. Disappointing indeed! The room was the size of a cupboard!!!! Due to some other issues with the room we were rapidly 'upgraded' to another marginally larger room on the floor above, which was kind of the helpful receptionist. This time it had a street facing window which was something but the bed was huge and took up the entire room, we had to squeeze sideways to get between the desk and the bed and it wasn't possible to open cupboard doors completely. The Arioso claims 4 stars but it is clearly a sneaky 3 star kidding itself. Later I found that the 4 star rating by France Toursime can simply mean that the hotel has a lift! This hotel is okay but it is by no means 'designer cool' as I was led to believe. Its location is close to a metro station which is very helpful as there are few restaurants around. If you stay here, do your research on where to eat as there are several over-priced tourist trap bistros on Blvd Haussmann and Rue Boetie (yuk!). Breakfast is expensive and very ordinary. Even by Paris standards, this place is pokey. Perhaps the upstairs premium rooms are better but I'll be seeking out a true 4 star next time and not a pretender.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Gem - walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: MoxieMT
Reviews.Content: Only in Paris for a couple of days, the Arioso helped us make the most our time. The friendly staff pointed us in the right direction for sightseeing and then printed driving directions to our destination in Brittany. Rooms were cute and tidy - the bathroom was spotless and reasonably sized. Very quiet location and inside. Only drawback: it was a bit of an adventure to find while driving a rental car in Paris :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfect”
Reviews.Author: belle8772
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arioso was exactly what we expected. The hotel was full of charm and kindness. It was truly a wonderful Parisian experience. Yes, it was on the small side, but rather than seeing this as a negative, I prefer to look at it as quaint. The room was small but quiet. The cleanliness was exquisite and brought a feeling of luxury. The location was great, easy to the metro and all sight seeing spots. The hotel employees were gracious, sweet, and kind. They were all amazing. We booked our room with a special and it came with breakfast which was perfectly european. I only wish that I could sit in that beautiful room each morning for breakfast. The day we left, we had to leave quite early. The gentleman working the night shift knew this as he arranged our taxi. When we made our way downstairs he had set up a breakfast special for my mother and I in the sitting room. It was truly wonder and he without a doubt went above and beyond. I only wish that you could find hotels in the US with this service and charm. If you are looking for a charming parisian experience, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you're big on small”
Reviews.Author: GuyMercer
Reviews.Content: The Arioso is really nicely decorated and furnished hotel in a great (and safe) area of Paris. I stayed here for three nights in February. It was one of the few hotels I actually managed to sleep well in (not too hot or cold) and there was no noise from the road or other guests! The drawback is that it is just too small. There is no bar or restaurant, and breakfast seems to be served in the lobby. I skipped it each time and went around the corner for a much more reasonably priced coffee and coissant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Arioso
HotelInfo.Address: 7 Rue d'Argenson | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
